snippet: Groups that spent millions on the national election have little to show for it, but efforts at the state level — including a drive to set back labor in Michigan — were strikingly successful.
abstract: Michigan Legislature's approval of right-to-work law, banning requirements that workers pay union dues or fees, is strikingly successful victory for Republicans; much of groundwork for quick victory was laid months and years before by loose network of donors, strategists and conservative political groups that has sought to win Republican control of legislatures around the country and limit political power of unions.

byline.original: By NICHOLAS CONFESSORE and MONICA DAVEY

lead_paragraph: Groups that spent millions on the national election have little to show for it, but efforts at the state level — including a drive to set back labor in Michigan — were strikingly successful.

headline.seo: Republican Donors Make Gains in States
headline.main: Michigan Effort Shows G.O.P. Sway in State Contests
headline.print_headline: Michigan Efforts Shows G.O.P. Sway in State Contests
